channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:

item.title: Flytip of Plastic filled bags, 26th September
item.description:
The location is the top of Aggs Hill about half way until the road is designated Cotswold Way. The tip is on the Right Hand side going towards the Burnt Oak Crossroads but before the wooded part where there is a Field Gate which is also a passing place on the road. Please can these be cleared up as they have been there for a few days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavements in very bad condition, 22nd September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18 Arle Drive, Cheltenham

item.title: Vegetation at side of road encroaching on road, 20th September
item.description:

item.title: Drain blockage, 20th September
item.description:
The drain outside of number 21 whaddon avenue is clogged. Someone threw a cigarette butt into it and it started a small fire. I soaked it in water of course, but in truth the drain could do with a good flushing out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Whaddon Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reoccurring potholes, 20th September
item.description:
The potholes along this stretch of the road are frequently and inadequately patched. There is another one or 2 that have developed. This could do with a better patch with the winter months approaching when this part of the road will have more instances of not fixed correctly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Walnuts GLOUCESTER, Tredington
Report on FixMyStreet
